pieces1.definition: Sugar molecules made up of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen. Created by photosynthesis.

pieces1.hint: Quick energy source. Examples include: breads, rice, potatoes, vegetables. Monomer is monosaccharide.

pieces1.definition: Biomolecules that perform most cellular work, make up enzymes, made up of carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen.

pieces1.hint: Examples include: fish, beef, poultry. Monomer is amino acid.

pieces1.definition: Biomolecule which is used for insulation and long term energy storage. Composed of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen.

pieces1.hint: Long term energy. Makes up cell membrane, which has a hydrophilic head and hydrophobic tail.

pieces1.definition: Large biomolecules used for storing genetic information aka the 'blueprint' of the cell. Made up of carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and phosophorus.

pieces1.hint: This biomolecule is makes up DNA and RNA. The monomer is a nucleotide.

pieces1.definition: A molecule that can be bonded together with an identical molecule to form a polymer.

pieces1.hint: Examples include: monosaccarides for carbs, amino acids for proteins, and nucleotids for nucleic acids

pieces2.definition: Made up of proteins, these molecules help lower the activation energy and act as a biological catalyst.

pieces2.hint: Allow chemical reactions to use less energy, have an active site, can be used over and over.

pieces2.definition: Region on an enzyme that has a specific shape and binds to a protein or other molecule during a chemical reaction.

pieces2.hint: This would be the slot in a lock that accepts key that fits it exactly.

pieces2.definition: A molecule upon which an enzyme acts. It/they are the reactants in a chemical reaction with enzymes.

pieces2.hint: This would be the key that fits into the specific 'lock' or active site of an enzyme.

pieces2.definition: This occurs when the shape of an enzyme changes due to environmental influences.

pieces2.hint: Increasing the temperature too high or changing the pH of the environment can cause this to happen to an enzyme.

pieces2.definition: The amount of energy required for a chemical reaction to take place.

pieces2.hint: Enzymes lower this in order to speed up the rate of chemical reactions.
